content.description:
Begin in a slick and insecure corner, stem up and over touchy terrain to the first two bolts under a small roof. Pull out right past a flake (crux) up to a sloping horizontal edge. Move right onto the face using a few small side-pulls and pockets. Finish steep at a two bolt anchor.

Worth doing if you're hard up.....maybe.
content.protection: Nine draws for seven bolts and an anchor.
content.location:
On the far left side of the

Necromancer

pile. See topo.

content.description:
A powerful boulder problem marks the start of this area land mine (prop a rock if you can't reach any of the holds). A few careful steps and some questionable movement will get you squared up at a good stance and the first, high bolt. Considerably easier climbing follows the arete using a mixture of small edges and pockets. Finish a a set of chains.

....umm, its something to do?
content.protection: Seven draws for five bolts and a chain anchor.
content.location:
On the right side of the

Necromancer

pile is a short, steep roof with a high bolt. This is

Return of the Prince

.

content.description: A thin and balancy, slightly overhung start past the first bolt, then less-than-vertical crimps, sidepulls and pockets the rest of the way. Eases up a bit after the fourth bolt.
content.location: The third bolted route from the left. Ascends to the right set of anchors.

content.description:
Start thin and balancy on sidepulls, crimps and a small pocket or two. Continue up the overhanging rock through a couple of large pockets/small ledges.

After the third bolt go right around the arete for the original route, or go left for a newer, harder finish.

Avoid stemming across the bottom for the full effect.
content.protection: 5 bolts for the original route, 7 bolts for the left variation. Chain anchors.
content.location: The second bolted line from the left.
